subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
{{Han etyl}}
In the oracle bone script, it was {{Han compound|黍|口|ls=ic|nocap=1|t1=glutinous millet|t2=mouth}}.

In the seal script, the {{zh-l|*口}} was replaced with the related {{zh-l|*甘|sweet}}.

Currently, the {{zh-l|*黍}} has simplified into {{zh-l|*禾}}, and the form of the bottom component {{zh-l|*甘}} has become akin to the unrelated {{zh-l|*曰}} or {{zh-l|*日}}.

subSections.title: Definitions
subSections.text:
{{zh-hanzi}}

# [[fragrant]]; [[fragrance]]
#: {{zh-ant|臭}}
# {{lb|zh|of|food}} [[aromatic]]; [[delicious]]-smelling
# {{lb|zh|of eating}} having the [[appearance]] that one really [[enjoy]]s the [[food]]; {{lb|zh|of sleep}} [[sound]]
# [[popular]]
# [[perfume]]
# {{lb|zh|religion}} [[joss stick]]; [[incense]] {{zh-mw|m:束|支}}
# {{lb|zh|figurative}} [[woman]]
# to [[kiss]]
# {{lb|zh|Cantonese|euphemistic}} to [[die]]
